app.all.description: This method is like the standard app.METHOD() methods, except it matches all HTTP verbs.

app.disable.description: Sets the Boolean setting name to false, where name is one of the properties from the app settings table. Calling app.set('foo', false) for a Boolean property is the same as calling app.disable('foo').

app.disabled.description: Sets the Boolean setting name to false, where name is one of the properties from the app settings table.

app.enable.description: Sets the Boolean setting name to true, where name is one of the properties from the app settings table.

app.enabled.description: Returns true if the setting name is enabled (true), where name is one of the properties from the app settings table.
